name: Bloodsports.TV
description: Co-Op Hero Defense set in a deadly post-apocalyptic Sweden. Team up with your friends and protect the Missile Silo against horrific beasts and outlaws.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista*, Windows 7, Windows 8 Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo E4600 or AMD Athlon 64 X2 4800+ Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Radeon HD 5450 (1 GB) or GeForce GT 430 (1 GB) DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 2 GB available space Additional Notes: Windows Vista x86 SP2 with DirectX 10 Update Installed
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or higher Processor: Intel Core i5 650 or AMD Phenom II X4 830+ Graphics: Radeon HD 6950 (1GB) or Geforce GTX560 (1GB)+ DirectX: Version 11 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Do you like playing League of Legends, but only really enjoy co-op? Then you are going to love this game.  It's a bunch of MOBA-esque things, like building items, the top-down view and QWER abilities, but instead of going against another team you're fighitng against hordes of mobs. Surprisingly difficult, but an absolute blast to play with other people. Plenty of unlockables as you play on harder difficulties and work your way up the ladders with your favored characters, each of which have different flavors that are all neat in their own way.  And that five pack is just so damn affordable.

A fun hero defense game that can be played both alone or with up to other 4 players, with a diverse item system and several maps with several different dificulty levels. I highly recommendy to anyone who likes Co-op games and/or Warcraft 3 & its multiple custom game modes (like me).  (This Not a MOBA, its' purely PvE, it only plays in a slightly similar way due to the controls, but this is just because, like MOBAs, this game is inspired by a Warcraft 3 type of map, Hero defense. MOBAs came from the AoS map type.)

I picked this up in a Humble bundle and at first I wasnt to sure what it was. After giving it a go I was hooked. If you like to play a MOBA stayle game that involes teamwork fighting waves of emimeis I would highly recomend this. Looking foward to seeing what other content they have installed for this game.

Does anyone remember hero defense maps on Warcraft III? This is pretty much the exact same thing, with a slightly better system and a different skin.  Pros: It's viscerally fun, it's bloody, requires a bit of teamwork.  Cons: Not many classes, Endless mode is just the same 10 waves over and over, the item store is a little hard to navigate at first, and around the 3rd iteration it becomes nigh impossible to continue unless everyone specced to defense.  If you can pick it up for cheap, it's a nice time sink for a while.

Swedish humor in its most swedish way. Anybody who appreciates swenglish announcers and jokes understood mainly by swedes will love this game. Everybody else should play it anyway, because it is sweeeet.  Imagine Enfo's, back in the days of WarCraft 3 UMS. Now take that, and make it AWESOME. Although there are a shortage of classes compared to enfo's, I really think it's better to have a good core than a multitude of ♥♥♥♥ nobody will understand anyway. Each class has an option of being more of the class, i.e. a tank/tank or a dps/tank. Or a healer/healer or a dps/healer, which is quite enjoyable if you're tired of always being the one that gets stuck with a certain role.  On a minor note, the channeling times for the enemies are a bit broken and unfortunately mean timing dodges are a bit of a challenge.  All in all, an awesome game.

The game is repetitive, I don't mind that though since I like these types of games. It's top down similar to Diablo and Dota, you choose from 4 types of characters - tank, damage dealer, disabler and healer. Each has different characters to them as well with different abilities. There are bunch of arenas much like tower defense games with different layouts but this is not a tower defense game. You have to defend the main core from the waves of enemies trying to get to it. There is something similar to skill tree or path where you unlock power ups for the characters by fulfilling tasks. You need those power ups to play on higher difficulties. The main issues with the game is that there are almost no people playing it, you might be able to find some in the forums though.

Note: This game was reviewed using a key sent by the developer.  Bloodsports.TV is a moba type game where the main goal is to survive with your team mates but will you want to play it ?  Bloodsports. TV has a very simple concept. It play's like a online battle arena, but the goal is not to destroy the base of other players. This game is a wave based survival game where the main goal is to protect a rocket and fight until the game is over.  Graphics are pretty awesome. The cell shaded look is really nice and some of the character models look really nice. Overall there's not much to talk about the art style.  The soundtrack is really good as it's composed by Mega Drive (Also did Hotline Miami). The sound effects in game though aren't that good. Some of the voice acting is incredibly bad.  The game has co op but there's a big problem. The game is already dead so if you do buy it be prepared to either get friends who play the game or play solo which get's boring really quickly.   You can choose how long do you want the matches to be. But the best decision is to make the matches four waves long as it doesn't last too long and it's just the right amount of time.   I didn't encounter any bugs while playing the game. There is a minor problem where sometimes my character wouldn't do a spell even though I had enough mana.  Overall Bloodsports.TV is a really good idea and the execution is really good, but the game is dead and playing Solo isn't that fun. I do suggest trying the game if you have friends who play it or you don't mind playing solo. I give Bloodsports.TV a 7/10
A fun MOBA game. It is great all around except the low number of champions (but they are quite unique nevertheless) and lack of online players. I wish there were more people online.

Fun, simple, co-operative, tower defense game. The item purchasing and skill levelling borrows from the MOBA League of Legends and the game's attitude is similar to Borderlands. Only buy if you have friends to play with, the community is dead.
Best PVE Moba! Period.
Better then dota 2 and LOL
This game alot more enjoyable with friends and dam does the difficulty ramp up. It was worth a play if you can get cheap like i did. PVE Moba style tower defence.
Fun Cooperative MOBA. Needs more classes and more customization to be a player in the genre however.

Really fun multiplayer game. Picked it up in a bundle quite cheap and already put quite a few hours into it. It is a tad repetitive but for some reason I keep wanting to play. Character progression is also decent and a nice feature. Give this game a go :)
Really fun game to pick up and play with your friends. I would pay more for this but the price alone just makes it even better.

Really fun idea for a MOBA. I liked the whole coop idea.  Only issue is cannot find any playable servers. Probably due to my location but i am not seeing anyone on?  Review Edit: I can now find people and people are joinning my games quickly. This is a great coop moba game and i highly recommend. Looking forward to what they add to this in the future.

Even in this game I can't escape teemo.... The scouts code Item aswell as the blowdart which builds into it. *Facepalm* Besides that though, this is a pretty great game for the 10$ price tag. If you have friends it is an even greater reason to all get this and play it together in 5 player Co-Op mayhem. Reminds me of my old days of playing Wc3 hero defense type maps. Love it!

This game is seriously great fun, I play competitive Heroes of the Storm quite a lot and was looking for something casual to play in co-op with my friends when we weren't in a competitive mood - this game hit all the right spots.  However someway through a co-op game each of us start lagging out and dropping from the session like flies (despite all having decent internet connections), trying to re-join mid-session just greets you with an endless loading screen while still being able to hear the action as if you're in the game.  We tried for a good 2 hours and couldn't all stay in a game together for more than 10 minutes. Which really saddened me, especially now that I've since found out the game has basically been abandoned so we have no chance of getting that particular bug fixed.  As a single player game, it probably works flawlessly - but try to play with your friends and what feels like an excellently unique and fun co-op moba-brawler, will start to feel like a complete waste of your time.
The game is fun, but there is no one ever online. I would have given this at least an 8/10 but it's litirally IMPOSSIBLE to find anyone online. rip bloodsports
